html body text table tbody tr td p em strong span
content: "If you're interested in us, we're interested in you!"

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p font span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: We're trying out a new location this year. New club-member Randy Word has a big ranch down near Granbury, and he's graciously allowed us to hold our shindig there. There's plenty of back-to-nature stuff to do there (hiking, fishing, etc) and lots of great activities for kids. Randy has also offered to smoke a batch of ribs for us, so we'll have plenty to eat and do.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: We'll likely be having a gift-exchange, so

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p strong span
content: bring along a wrapped gift worth under $10 if you'd like to participate

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: It also looks like we're going to have a bigger-than-average group of young kids there, so if you bring along a wrapped toy (please keep it in the under-$5 range), we'll try to do a gift exchange for the kiddos. If your kid is older than about 8, the grownup exchange would probably be better.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p strong span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
html body text table tbody tr td p strong span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: Sunday, December 17, noon until whenever (Randy has a fire-pit and cabins if we spend too much time partying)

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p strong span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: YOU! Okay, anyone who's ever been faced annoyance or condemnation for not following majority-owned holidays. We'll celebrate any winter holiday you'd like.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p strong span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: Randy will be smoking ribs and sausages, but we'll need any further fixins. If you'd like to bring some chips or soda or dessert or such, email

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p a span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: and I'll help coordinate snacks so we don't end up with twenty bowls of dip and no chips.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p strong span
html body text table tbody tr td p strong span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: Take 377 SW from I20 in SW Fort Worth towards Granbury (Benbrook exit).

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: Stay on 377 thru Cresson and on to Granbury, take 377 Business to downtown Granbury (the square with large rock courthouse).

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: Go to the end of the square (1 block) and turn right on Hwy 4.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: Go thru town and then Hwy 4 angles/turns to the left immediately upon crossing the RR tracks.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: Continue on Hwy 4 to Thorp Spring. Stay on Hwy 4 to far end of town and look for FM 2580. Stay straight on Hwy 4 but immediately check your odometer. Go exactly 4.5mi from 2580 intersection to the turn into the ranch. There will be a street sign there that says "Ruff Country". You can only turn right so turn right onto Ruff Country (gravel road)

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: Again check you odometer and go exactly 0.9mi There will be an open steel gate on your right. There is a green street sign attached to the gate that says "Randy Rd". Turn right and you are now in the ranch.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: Continue another 3/4mi on gravel/dirt road that will twist and turn and go down a steep hill and eventually across a creek. Don't give up, if you take a wrong turn inside the ranch just keep driving and you will find it.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: Phone numbers: 254 646 2226 (ranch house) or my cell 972 342 7958 (may or may not work)

content: Following the closing of the old Humanist Hall in Grapevine, we'll be holding our November meeting at the NEW Humanist Hall in North Richland Hills. It's a good location with plenty of local eateries in reach.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: So come see us on the third Sunday at 11 AM (but not in December, because that's the party-day).

content: Metroplex Atheists is an organization for atheists in the Fort Worth and Dallas metropolitan area to meet, socialize, discuss issues of importance to atheists, and plan activism. Metroplex Atheists meet every 3rd Sunday of each month. Please join us and meet your neighborhood atheists.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td h4 span
html body text table tbody tr td blockquote p b span
html body text table tbody tr td blockquote p span
content: Metroplex Atheists meets at 11:00 AM on the 3rd Sunday of every month at

tag: html body text table tbody tr td blockquote p a span
content: Humanist Hall, 7100 Boulevard 26, Suite 304, Richland Hills TX. We're in Suite 304 (third floor)

tag: html body text table tbody tr td blockquote p span
html body text table tbody tr td blockquote p span
content: It's easy to reach. From Dallas or Fort Worth, get on highway 114. When you reach the Northwest Highway exit in Grapevine, head north 1.4 miles. Turn left on Main for about a block, and the building is on the right.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td blockquote p span
content: If you want door-to-door directions, click on the map link above, then click "get directions".

tag: html body text table tbody tr td blockquote p b span
html body text table tbody tr td blockquote p span
content: Several members of Metroplex Atheists also meet socially at

tag: html body text table tbody tr td blockquote p a span
html body text table tbody tr td blockquote p span
content: in Arlington on Wednesday nights. It's on Abrams Street just east of the municipal complex. We usually meet around 6-7 pm. They close at 10 pm, but we're usually out before then. Hope to see you there!

content: If you've got a free Tuesday, check out the

tag: html body text table tbody tr td blockquote p a span

content: . We meet at 7 pm in various locations around Dallas and Plano. Keep an eye on the web page for announcements!

tag: html body text table tbody tr td ul li table tbody tr td p a span
html body text table tbody tr td ul li table tbody tr td p span
content: CD-ROM collection. These are collections of obscure atheist literature available on CD-ROM for low prices. Many of these works are very obscure and are only available publicly in these collections. The pictured Robert Ingersoll CD, for example, contains the entire 12-volume Dresden Edition collection of his speeches and writings. This collection would cost over $1000 if purchased on paper, but you can get it on CD-ROM for around $25.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td center p b span
html body text table tbody tr td center blockquote blockquote blockquote p span
content: "Because we must. Because we have the call. Because it is nobler to fight for rationality without winning than to give up in the face of continued defeats. Because whatever true progress humanity makes is through the rationality of the occasional individual and because any one individual we may win for the cause may do more for humanity than a hundred thousand who hug superstition to their breasts."

tag: html body text table tbody tr td center blockquote p span
content: -- Isaac Asimov, when asked why he fights religion with no hope for victory
